subject: Re: [junit] Re: TestResult extension for elapsed time of test?
msgSnippet: ... That method is an idiom of the runner interfaces.  I wouldn t suggest trying to override at that point. TestCase also has a createResult() method which you
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> TFRooney wrote:
>
> > Thanks, I can see how that would work. I'm still curious as to how to
> > replace the TestResult with a subclassed version. It seems that
> > TestRunner has TestResult hardcoded as the default. Is there a way to
> > pass in a replacement?
>
> Somewhere in the framework is the method createTestResult(). If you
> subclassed that class and overrode that method, that might be enough.
> Everything else seems to take TestResult as a parameter.


That method is an idiom of the runner interfaces. I wouldn't suggest
trying to override at that point.

TestCase also has a createResult() method which you can override if you
prefer to use the TestResult route.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
